Title: Transition finance in turbulent times: OCBC on decarbonising Asia's toughest sectors
Summary: Global sustainability setbacks will not affect the lender’s transition engagement efforts with businesses, especially those committed to their net zero efforts, says OCBC's Yoonmee Jeong.

Title: 'Greenrinsing': Firms setting and dropping net-zero targets to create revolving door for finance, says UN official
Summary: Some firms have been gaming their climate targets to attract investment, with most struggling to cut "impossible" supply chain emissions, the UN Global Compact Network Thailand boss said at an event in Singapore last week.

Title: IEA: Renewables have cut fossil fuel imports for more than 100 countries
Summary: More than 100 countries have cut their dependence on fossil-fuel imports and saved hundreds of billions of dollars by continuing to invest in renewables, according to the International Energy Agency (IEA).

Title: 'Performative gesture': Voices of Palestinians on statehood
Summary: A symbolic gesture or a step forward? Palestinians in Europe voice their views on statehood recognition.

Title: Asia Pacific’s clean energy capacity set to nearly double over next five years
Summary: India accounts for more than half of the expected growth, followed by Pakistan, Japan and Australia, finds new data from the International Energy Agency.

Title: UN calls for transition metals mining finance reform to protect environment and human rights
Summary: A UN report warns that financing for critical minerals must align with environmental and social goals if the energy transition is to avoid repeating the harms of the fossil fuel era.

Title: Convenient infrastructure, consistent collection key to strengthening Malaysia's EPR model: experts
Summary: Retailers and recyclers say that collection efforts must be made practical and easy enough for consumers, which can be done through clearer guidance on packaging labels and mandatory education about circularity.

Title: Q&A: What does China’s new Paris Agreement pledge mean for climate action?
Summary: President Xi Jinping has personally pledged to cut China’s greenhouse gas emissions to 7 to 10 per cent below peak levels by 2035, while “striving to do better”.

Title: Trees are natural ACs for cities, if you plant the right ones
Summary: Urban trees are on the rise but researchers are only starting to uncover the best way to cool cities with them.

Title: Q&A: How recognising Palestine affects stateless Palestinians
Summary: Countries deny Palestinians protections as they are no longer considered stateless after statehood recognition, legal expert says.

Title: As NZBA shuts down membership model, Southeast Asian banks reaffirm decarbonisation efforts
Summary: The alliance to decarbonise the finance sector will transition its guidance into a framework. Malaysia-headquartered bank CIMB said it would continue updating the guidance and resources developed by the NZBA.

Title: Pakistan must shape its clean energy future
Summary: Cheaper batteries from China are driving an energy shift in a country beset by power cuts, but some worry about waste and the people left behind.

Title: EAT-Lancet report: Three key takeaways on climate and diet change
Summary: A global shift towards “healthier” diets could cut non-CO2 greenhouse gas emissions, such as methane, from agriculture by 15 per cent by 2050, according to a new report.

Title: No route home: Climate change threatens Kashmir’s nomadic traditions
Summary: As ancestral migration routes collapse under climate stress, pastoralist communities in northern India could be forced to abandon not just their livelihoods, but an entire way of life.

Title: Fewer Singaporean firms are declaring sustainability targets amid delayed reporting rules
Summary: A new study finds a three-year downward trend in corporate transparency on sustainability goals in Singapore. Three in four firms have delayed targets or made revisions, but most say sustainability remains a priority.

Title: More CEOs confident of achieving net-zero targets by using AI, finds KPMG
Summary: Corporate leaders anticipate that the strategic use of artificial intelligence can help accelerate sustainability efforts, including the use of AI to improve data quality and reporting.

Title: IEA reiterates ‘no new oil and gas needed’ if global warming is limited to 1.5°C
Summary: The world would not need to invest in new oil and gas projects if demand for the fuels fell in line with the 1.5°C limit on global warming, says the International Energy Agency (IEA).

Title: Roundtable: What next for fisheries subsidies?
Summary: A global agreement to curb subsidies for fishing fleets could be an ocean conservation breakthrough if it works as intended, five experts say.

Title: Aid after Gaza: what is the future of the humanitarian system?
Summary: International charities say Israel is weaponising new model of privatised, militarised aid to further war aims.

Title: Making the case for an interconnected power grid – a ‘pragmatic path’ for Asean to achieve urgent net zero targets
Summary: A connected grid will help each country avoid bearing the burden of building power for itself – forcing low-cost decisions that might not be climate-friendly, says a representative from GE Vernova at Enlit Asia 2025.
